body:
> Not sure if possible: errors in programs which access syncthing via the api. For example the "no space left on device" error from syncthing-ionotify would be highly interesting to know about.

This would require REST API that can client use to send error message and _that_ would require client to be able to send anything when error is caught or even after crashing. It's not impossible, but can be done much simpler on client side.

@kozec As far as I can see this should already work:

> **POST /rest/error**
> Post with an error message in the body (plain text) to register a new error. The new error will be displayed on any active GUI clients.

From: https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/wiki/REST-Interface

issue.title: Feature: More meaningful errors in the GUI

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Hi.

"The folder <some foldername> isn't making progress. Check logs...."

Is just not a user friendly error to throw on the users. Instead the error should tell WHY the folder does not making progress. 

i.e:
"The folder "picts" isn't making progress because of an error. The error is: File picture1.jpg - permission denied while changing ctime of the file. Check file permissions, making sure the ovner of the syncthing process is allowed to write to the file"

It's fine to have this info in the logs /Stdout too but the GUI should really reflect the error that syncthing are throwing and giving the user a chance to know what went wrong and why for him to solve the issues.

All other errors that affects the syncprocess should also be communicated to the user in a more user friendly way" the user should really not go to the logs to find theese informations. This will really enhance the UX and the feel of this great piece of software, even for a experienced user like me. 

Thanks

issue.title: Folder "XYZ" isn't making any progress ...

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Hi there, 
this is a BUG REPORT, I'm using v0.10.23 on OSX Yosemite and v0.10.23 via the app on Cyanogenmod.

I'm syncing files from OSX to the phone. As the phone kept flashing a warning message with "Folder 'XYZ' isn't making any progress." "... pausing puller for a minute (or something like that)" after restarting syncthing / deleting and reinitializing the repository several times, I started looking if specific files were not transferred.

As it turns out, files cannot be transferred if they have a slash, "/", in their name. I tested it with a number of different files in number of different folders and this is reproducibly the cause. 

I had the same issue as well on files not containing a slash. Strangely it was possible to upload such a file to one directory, but not to another. Since I couldn't really pinpoint the problem I have a FEATURE REQUEST: In the given warning message, "Folder 'XYZ' isn't making any progress. ...", please add the name and path of the files that the puller is/was working on. This way one can at least do something with the files that are causing the issue.

issue.body:
Hi there,

Something i wished for since im using syncthing, are data like:

which files did a node already sync and which not

right now i only know the last time the node was online and that it finished (?) at least one file.
thats not very much. 
last synced file is cute, but i dont see why it has a place in the gui when other more meaningful data doesnt.

i guess some of that information can be obtained through log files, but i hope its planned to move some  of the data like this into the gui

i tried to search for a similar thread but didnt find anything, sorry if that topic was already requested.

keep going with the good work.

issue.title: Syncing stuck at 76% on one side

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Syncing is stuck on one side. The other side is done. The unstuck side is master of a folder that has a red "Override Changes" button. I don't recall doing anything in the user interface or explicit control of syncthing to cause that button to appear.

So, the surface issue is how to get unstuck. Something like this has happened before and I got unstuck by clicking on the red button. I'm not clicking on it just yet in case we need to do any triaging.

The real issue, I think though, is why I can inadvertently get into such a weird state in the first place. There have been lots of issues of people getting stuck synchronization. I haven't seen all of them but the few that I've seen ended up with people doing some non-obvious workaround. For my case, I have to say it's a confusing problem with a non-intuitive workaround. Is there a bug with the synchronization protocol itself that makes such events unavoidable? Or is it a bug with the implementation of the protocol?

body:
2/3 are resolved:
- Any reason why a folder was stopped. "The folder isn't making progress. Check logs...." should become "The folder 'picts' isn't making progress because of an error. The error is: File picture1.jpg - permission denied while changing ctime of the file. Check file permissions, making sure the owner of the Syncthing process is allowed to write to the file"
- ~~Not sure if possible: errors in programs which access syncthing via the api. For example the "no space left on device" error from syncthing-ionotify would be highly interesting to know about.~~
- ~~Failure to create port mappings via UPnP (this has cost me nearly two hours, because I've been debugging the wrong side :-( )~~
@Zillode Thanks for the update. I modified the original post to reflect the current state of development.

issue.body:
Running ST **0.11.0** on Xubuntu 15.04

When ST starts, this message is output:

```
Error creating discovery client  udp6://announce-v6.syncthing.net:22026 Unsupported scheme:
```

It doesn't seem to have any impact whatsoever, since ST is working fine.

I started it with `STTRACE=discover`: here's the [log](http://bpaste.net/show/b20318ecd272), and my [config.xml](http://bpaste.net/show/b4d41f7feecc).

issue.title: 'Disappearing' files result in puller pause on other devices

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
When I add /.config/pulse to .stignore on device A, device B will produce the following errors:

```
INFO: Puller (folder "home", file ".config/pulse/a569e851e314484ba25702ea5b1b6fb6-device-volumes.tdb"): pull: no available source device
INFO: Puller: final: no available source device
WARNING: Folder "home" isn't making progress - check logs for possible root cause. Pausing puller for 1m0s.
```

However, the .stignore file will soon be synced to the other devices, and once they reload it the warning will disappear. 

What would be a good way to solve this?

otherwise: very good tool! thank you!
andrew
